summary: The bill, the Small Projects Expedited Execution and Delivery Act (SPEED Act), amends MAP-21 to modify provisions related to categorical exclusions for projects with limited federal assistance. It increases the financial thresholds for projects eligible for these expedited processes. Specifically, it raises the limit in subparagraph (A) from $6,000,000 to $12,000,000 and in subparagraph (B) from $35,000,000 to $70,000,000, thereby accelerating the approval of certain infrastructure projects.
